articles.title: 27 Dead, Dozens Missing as Ships Carrying Asylum Seekers Sink Off Italian Coast
articles.description: At least 27 people have drowned and dozens remain missing after two ships carrying asylum seekers from Libya capsized off the Italian island of Lampedusa. About 60 survivors were rescued from the sea. Since 2014, over 32,000 people have died attempting to cross the Mediterranean to seek asylum in Europe, with over 700 deaths or disappearances so far this year alone.

articles.title: Trump to Meet Putin in Alaska Summit
articles.description: A high-stakes summit between U.S. President Trump and Russian President Putin is set for August 15 in Anchorage, Alaska. Key topics include a ceasefire in Ukraine and potential follow-up diplomacy involving Ukrainian President Zelenskyy. Trump has warned that Putin will face "very severe consequences" if no peace deal is reached.

articles.title: Historic Flood in Milwaukee Declared a "1,000-Year Event"
articles.description: Severe flash flooding over August 9–10 dumped record-breaking rainfall on Milwaukee and nearby suburbs, prompting a state of emergency declaration by Governor Tony Evers. The Wisconsin State Fair’s final day was canceled, and FEMA disaster aid has been requested.
